result.value:
The *TRamWAy* library features various tools for the analysis of particle dynamics in Single Molecule Localization Microscopy (SMLM) data.
It can resolve the diffusivity, drift, force and potential energy in space and time. 
The [original documentation](https://tramway.readthedocs.io) is now on [readthedocs](https://tramway.readthedocs.io). 
An attempt to rewrite the project documentation is available as a [separate project and web resource](https://tramway-tour.readthedocs.io).
Please favor Conda, as Conda will seamlessly install the HDF5 standard library which is a required dependency.

```
pip install tramway
```

`pip install` will install some Python dependencies if missing, but you may still need to install the [HDF5 reference library](https://support.hdfgroup.org/downloads/index.html).

Note that the HDF5 library can usually be installed using any OS' package manager.
Only Windows users may have to [manually download and install the HDF5 library](https://tramway.readthedocs.io/en/latest/libhdf5.html), if they do not wish to use Conda instead of pip.

Several installation targets are available, including `full`, that install optional dependencies:

```
pip install tramway[full]
```

Most of the functionalities and code examples described in the documentation will run without optional dependencies.
It is safe to first install *TRamWAy* with minimal requirements and then `pip install` the missing dependencies as you hit `ImportError` while using *TRamWAy*.

```
conda install tramway -c conda-forge
```

Compared with the bare package `pip` installs (with no installation targets), the `conda` package specifies some optional dependencies as required, so that the above command installs them.
However, many other optional dependencies are omitted.

result.description:
# Changelog

* Support for Python 3.12 (#45)
* Support for matplotlib>=3.6
* Pending deprecations from recent NumPy and Pandas fixed
* Implicit upper bounds on dependency versions relaxed
* Extra required dependency: *setuptools*
* New Apptainer images

# Changelog

* See MR https://github.com/DecBayComp/TRamWAy/pull/43.

# Changelog

* See PR https://github.com/DecBayComp/TRamWAy/pull/42.

# Changelog

* Fixes for types deprecated by recent Numpy (#38)

# Changelog

* Python 3.10 support
* refined installation instructions
* containers are now based on Focal Fossa with updated dependencies
* workaround in `analyzer.spt_data` for weird cases where `os.path.exists` returns `False` on existing files
* `analyzer.pipeline.early_setup` takes arguments `connect`  and `ensure_container`

Note: tag `v0.6.4` missed 1 commit. PyPI version 0.6.4 corresponds to the present release.

# Changelog

* rank-1 density in module `srtesseler_density`
* bugfix in `stochastic_dv` for recent Python versions that activate daemon mode at some point
* support for callable `sampling_label` in `stages.infer`
* bugfix in `tramway-browse` caused by dead code
* updated containers

# Changelog

* smoother Plotly-based surface plots with exact mesh if the Voronoi graph can be boxed, or higher resolution grid-sampled surface otherwise
* new singularity container in 4 flavors (for Python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8 and 3.9) with introspection to determine which Python to use in any similar container
* bugfix in GWR for oversized `residuals` attribute
* rwa autosaving mechanism admits a callable for attribute/argument `rwa_file` to lazily create temporary files in distributed `RWAnalyzer.pipeline` execution settings
* `PipelineStage` and `RWAnalyzer.pipeline.append_stage` admit argument `run_everywhere` for stages like *fresh_start*

# Changelog

* `roi.SupportRegion.add_sampling` and `stages.tessellate_and_infer` store more information about ROI in the `Partition` objects
* infinite recursion bugfix when copying `roi` objects
* default container points to the proper url

# Changelog

* `SingularitySlurm` features class methods `singularity_options` and `remote_dependencies`, as replacements for previous attributes
* color-coded force amplitude maps can be transformed with `logscale='log10'` or `transform='log10'`, depending on the drawing function

# Changelog

* `Partition` objects implement `__len__` that returns the number of assigned points (a point may count zero or multiple times)
* ~~energy unit displayed in brackets (*e.g.* `[kT]`) to give an indication that the notation is improper~~ (undone in v0.6rc1)
* so-called *degraded* inference methods renamed *unsmooth*
* `'semi.stochastic.dv'` plugin and `models` module in the `analyzer.mapper` package
* *standard* inference plugins can be interrupted
* in `'stochastic.dv'`, argument `ls_step_max` can be an array
result.name: 0.6-beta

result.description:
# Changelog

* default stopping criterion for `stochastic.dv` focuses on the worst-performing bin instead of the best-performing ones
* default action of the `resolution` attribute in wrappers from the `tramway.analyzer.tessellers` module revisited for increased consistency between methods
* most specialized `RWAnalyzer` attribute classes can be instanciated and assigned to the corresponding attributes
* `tessellate_and_infer` loads the *.rwa* files corresponding to the SPT data source, if the latter are not *.rwa* files
* `tramway.analyzer.mapper.plotly` module for surface plots of parameter maps
* the bokeh-based browser can be now launched from any notebook cell with attribute `this_notebook_cell_only`
* many fixes in the `tramway.analyzer.images` module
result.name: 0.6-alpha

result.description:
# Changelog

* pipeline bugfixes for local `RWAnalyzer` execution with no defined environment
* bugfix in *stochastic.dv* for old *macOS* versions that cannot pickle queues
* `clim` and more colormaps supported in `RWAnalyzer.browser`
* *bokeh* support for versions > 2.2.3 dropped

# Changelog

* support for old (pre-HDF5) *.mat* files
* `mapper.from_maps` helper in `tramway.analyzer`
* `time.get_spatial_segmentation`, `roi.add_collection` support made more ubiquitous
* backward-compatibility bugfix in `helper.roi`
* multiprocessing bugfix for macOS and Windows (affects `stochastic.dv`)
* GitHub action ci.yml

# Changelog

* border cells identification in Voronoi tessellations
* `stages.tessellate_and_infer` with support for partial interim files
* `single_path` argument to `stages.infer` as part of the support for partial interim files
* `PipelineStage.update_existing_rwa_files` as part of the support for partial interim files
* `SlurmOverSSH.resume` support for partial interim files
* `Analysis.rebase_tree` and `Analysis.save` as part of the support for partial interim files
* `Mapper.infer` support for output attributes in `FiniteElement` items
* `ROIAsciiFiles` support for multiple collections (arguments label and suffix can be tuples or lists)
* `ROIRecoveredFromSampling` as a recovery mechanism (its usage is discouraged)
* various bugfixes:
  * in `stages.restore_spt_data` in combination with `SPTAsciiFiles` (now properly reloaded as `RWAFiles`)
  * in `discard_static_trajectories` when no data are left

# Changelog

* composable map animations
* *.tiff* image support updated for more recent *scikit-image*; `imread` replaced by `MultiImage`
* bugfix for `Maestro` environment
* bugfix in multiple-*.rwa*-file reload

# Changelog

* RWAnalyzer pipeline building blocks `tessellate`, `reload` and `infer` in module `stages`
* Maestro environment in module `environments`
* bug fixes in RWAnalyzer for Windows file paths
* bug fix for indices in `roi.as_support_regions`
* bug fix for trajectory indices in support regions
This release is a major update that introduces the `tramway.analyzer` package and the `RWAnalyzer` class.
result.name: 0.5-rc1

result.description:
# Changelog

* low-level ROI management (module `tramway.helper.roi`)
* analysis trees can be automatically saved when modified (module `tramway.core.analyses.auto`)
* cell merging mechanism based on the number of assigned locations (argument `reassignment_options` for `tramway.helper.tessellation.tessellate`)
* the edge maximum lifetime (`edge_lifetime`) parameter for GWR tessellations can vary wrt the number of nodes
* various bugfixes (cropping already cropped SPT data, plotting open cells at the border, etc)

# Changelog

* `volume`/`spherical.volume` inference plugin + the `density` plugin admits argument `volume='spherical'`
* regularized `d`/`dd`/`df` converge more (`maxfun` properly set for l-BFGS-b, as in `dv`)
* various bugfixes with missing metadata, isolated cells and null forces/drifts

# Changelog

* cell grouping by bayes factor sign
* additional metadata in the analysis tree (datetime, os, python version, tramway version, etc)
* `track single` subcommand for adding a constant trajectory column to untracked location files
* improved diagnostics of common errors with input files
* bugfix in negative diffusivity lower bounds

# Changelog

* ``rgrad='delta0'`` in *dv* and *stochastic.dv* [0.3.11]
* ``debug`` argument to *stochastic.dv* mode with support for *ncalls*, *f_history*, *df_history*, *projg_history* and *error* [0.3.11]
* *stochastic.dv* mode set back to previous defaults including  ``superlocal=True`` and ``newton=True`` [0.3.11]
* multiprocessing in *stochastic.dv* mode disabled on Windows os

# Changelog

* ``time_knn`` argument for point-cell assignment of nearest temporal neighbours
* `Tessellation.set_adjacency`, `Voronoi.delete_cell`, `Voronoi.pack_indices`
* *standard.d/dd/df/dv* inference methods admit more gradient arguments/options
* `grad1` admits empty neighbour cells
* in `random_walk`: if ``reflect is True``, deltas are not appended [bugfix]
* in `find_artefacts`: with both labels and type filters defined, works properly with more than 3 levels [bugfix]

# Changelog

* parallelized `stochastic.dv`
* `local_variation` and `temporal_variation` as alternatives for `grad` and `time_derivative` respectively for the smoothing priors (`rgrad` argument/option)

# Changelog

* ``add_deltas`` in `~tramway.core.xyt.crop`; utility `tramway.utils.crop`
* subpackage `tramway.plot.animation`, helper `tramway.helper.animation`, subcommand `tramway animate` and utilities `tramway.utils.trajviz` and `tramway.utils.mapviz`
* ``min_n`` alias for ``strict_min_location_count`` (`tessellate`)
* ``enable_time_regularization=True`` as a shortcut for ``time_window_options=dict(time_dimension=True)`` (`tessellate`)
* `density` module for `infer`
* `d` => `degraded.d`, `dd`/`ddrift` => `degraded.dd`/`degraded.ddrift`, `df` => `degraded.df`, `smooth.d` => `standard.d`, `smooth.dd`/`smooth.ddrift` => `standard.dd`/`standard.ddrift`, `smooth.df` => `standard.df`

# Changelog

* the ``tramway`` command admits optional argument ``--segment`` for subcommands ``draw``/``show``
* memory leak fixed in *stochastic.dv*
* `map_plot` admits *pandas.Series* maps
* valid types for (trans-)location data restricted to *pandas.DataFrame*

# Changelog

* tutorials (Jupyter notebooks)
* load_xyt fails on improper number of columns and manages multi-space separators
* clearer error messages in load_xyt and tessellate

# Changelog

* *d.conj_prior* and *stochastic.dv* inference plugins
* trajectories can be supplied as *dx*, *dy* and *dt* in addition to *x*, *y* and  *t*
* basic headers in trajectory files are supported
* hexagonal meshes no longer leave locations outside a cell
* generated RW can be mirrored (*reflect* argument in *functional.random_walk*)
* *initial_trajectory_count* and *new_trajectory_count* arguments in *functional.random_walk* to control the number of newly generated trajectories at each time step
* much more

# Changelog

* *B_threshold* argument is properly passed to the *bayes_factors* plugin
* various bug fixes in the new *tessellate*/*tessellate1* and *infer*/*infer1* helpers
* *store_distributed* argument supported again in the *infer* helper
* random cell centers leading to empty cells are discarded per default; new argument *allow_empty_cells* in the *random* plugin

# Changelog (from release 0.3)

* *bayes_factors* subpackage in *tramway.inference*
* *d.snr* and *bayes_factor* inference plugins; *bayes_factor* can run on top of *d.snr*
* new maps can be inferred on top of existing maps; the parameters from the existing maps are made available in the `Locations`/`Translocations` cell objects as attributes
* '*returns*' key in the *setup* dictionnary of inference plugins to specify the returned arguments for each cell
* *sigma* and *sigma2* arguments to disambiguate *localization_error* that is currently *sigma* in most inference plugins and may become *sigma2*

# Changelog

* ``--profile`` and ``--seed`` command-line options for ``infer`` and ``tessellate`` respectively
* ``--points``, ``--delaunay``, ``--colormap``, ``--clip`` command-line options for ``draw map``
* forces have opposite directions in the *df* inference mode
* curl maps are represented at a level below force maps in the analysis tree
* rwa-python==0.5 integration (reduced file size)
* extra tests for the ``infer`` command
* various bugfixes
result.name: 0.3-rc3
